1: Handle "legacy" releases properly, kill python2.6 (#231)    Add "legacy" release      Break the tests      Do not return flask.Response object for legacy        When a release uses l10nChangesets: "legacy" (not available?), the      corresponding function (_getReleaseLocales) returns a flask.Response      object (generated by jsonify_by_sorting_values). This breaks the logic      when we export aggregated (combined betas) release JSON files, because      flask.Response is not JSON serializable.

9: Merge pull request #244 from escapewindow/intermittents-pt2  explicitly pass in an `event_loop` in testing.
11: explicitly pass in an `event_loop` in testing.  Create a `context.event_loop` property to standardize the loop we use. In regular usage, we default to `asyncio.get_event_loop()`. In testing, we're using `pytest-asyncio` which creates new `event_loop` fixtures per test and closes them at the end; and `pytest-xdist` which runs tests in parallel. When combined, bare `asyncio.get_event_loop()` calls can result in intermittent bustage (closed loop errors).  By modifying the `rw_context` fixture to populate its `event_loop` with the `pytest-asyncio` `event_loop`, we get most of the way to the fix. `main` and `rebuild_gpg_homedirs` are entry points that create their own `context` objects, so they now take optional `event_loop` kwargs to override the loop during testing.

This both removes a redundant fixture and hopefully fixes #238 (intermittent closed event loop errors on Travis).

0: No expires (#82)    Do not set task `expires`    It causes some issues with artifact uploads. By default Tascluster sets  this field to `deadline` + 1 year.      Version bump
2: Bug 1384938 - Add Treeherder group name to yml task definition (#80)    Bug 1384938 - Add Treeherder group name to yml task definition      Bug 1384938 treeherder group names for all tasks      Bug 1384938 update version number
6: Bug 641212 lzma (#76)    bug 1385946 update funsize tasks to cope with new signing formats      bump version      Bump worker image hash
7: bug 1385946 update funsize tasks to cope with new signing formats (#75)    bug 1385946 update funsize tasks to cope with new signing formats      bump version
9: Update funsize scheduler for public balrog api (#73)  This change will allow us to use the public balrog  API, that doesn't require credentials, and so remove  one dependent secret from the config.    It'll also be the same api that funsize uses when the  scheduler is rolled into the task graph generation.
10: BB windows has moved to 20 chunks (#72)
12: Update symbols (#70)    Improve symbol use in funsize      Remove use of chunk names from descriptions, as they're all the same in taskcluster
13: bug 1379197 fix insufficient history errors. (#68)  Previous version was falling through to the end of the function, and  so implicitly returning None, if there weren't enough historical  releases to build partials from
14: Bug 1381268 fix mac en-us partials (#67)    bug 1381268 macosx64 en-US was getting a detected locale of en-US.      bump version
15: bug 1379197 listen to date repo for tc migration testing (#66)    bug 1379197 listen to date repo for tc migration testing      update version number
17: Find gecko revision and balrog_props.json (#64)    Find gecko revision and balrog_props.json      Rename function
18: Previous task (#63)    Find gecko revision      Version bump
22: Bug 1303834, add funsize routes for oak repo (#58)
23: bug 1351567 Missed a component in the previous fix for this bug. Now checking against the correct value (#57)
24: bug 1348844 non-index routes in taskcluster (#55)  index.  will soon be handled differently, so need to ensure funsize listens to  non-index routes for the same data.
25: bug 1351567 - the existence of the current release in balrog means that update-1 is skipped, so rearrange the from_mar == to_mar detection such that we always get four updates (#56)
26: bug 1338176, funsize needs to work for aurora (#54)
27: bug 1336112 adjust parsing of pulse messages to cope with differences between en-US and locale repacks (#53)
28: bug 1334428, cope with nightly buildids that don't have all platforms. (#52)  Should also help with bug 1331707 and give the tasks more meaningful symbols in treeherder.    Since not every build has all platforms, we need to generate a list of relevant builds and  work on that, which means rearranging the internal loop.  Since submitting in the previous  place would then break the update_number, which makes it into the final MAR, move the  task submission out to the end, so we can generate the tasks in the proper order.    It means each Update-\d group in treeherder is for a particular 'from' generation, making  it hopefully easier to track what's going on.
29: this wasn't picked up by travis, because it calls py27 (#51)    this wasn't picked up by travis, because it calls py27      bump version number

0: Merge pull request #12 from escapewindow/retry-connectionerror  Retry for ConnectionError during upload.
2: switch to python 3.7 release; try to fix coveralls
3: Retry for ConnectionError during upload.  The remote_signfile function is pretty ugly and should be rewritten. However, I believe we were failing to retry because we're in the except block of the outer try/except, and the inner try/except didn't catch ConnectionError. RequestException should catch both HTTPError and ConnecitonError.  Fixes https://github.com/mozilla-releng/signingscript/issues/66 .
4: Merge pull request #11 from escapewindow/py36  py36 support
6: Use .gitignore file from other releng repos  This allows to ignore .pytest_cache/
7: Add tox tests against python 3.6 + split travis jobs per python version
8: Fix errors reported by flake8 new rules
11: Merge pull request #9 from escapewindow/fix-sig  stop munging dest now that `output_file` is working
14: stop munging path since we have output_file working
15: Merge pull request #8 from escapewindow/fix-output-file  actually use options.output_file

21: get an initial noop test of remote_signfile, for coverage

0: Bug 1470039 - Replace MozReview with Phabricator in setup instructions r=sheehan  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D2274
1: Bug 1486287 - version-control-tools: Add a warning to state that this is deprecated r?gps
2: [merge-day-hook] Only open unified repo once in merge day hook; r=gps  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4242
3: replicateowner: mark as Mercurial 4.7 compatible (Bug 1480228) r=gps  Remove all the 4.5 compatibility code for a nice cleanup while we're at it.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4233
4: readonly: mark as compatible with Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1480228) r=gps  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4232
5: qimportbz: mark as compatible with Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1480228) r=gps  Tests pass with no changes.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4231
6: qbackout: mark as compatible with Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1480228) r=gps  Test pass with no changes. I've decided not to remove legacy compatibility since the extension itself is legacy.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4230
7: push-to-try: mark as compatible with Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1480228) r=gps  Tests pass with no changes. Also remove 4.3 support with this commit.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4229
8: obsolescencehacks: mark as compatible with Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1480228) r=gps  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4228
9: manualoverlay: mark as Mercurial 4.7 compatible (Bug 1480228) r=gps  Tests pass with no changes. We also remove 4.3 support with this commit.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4227
10: firefoxtree: remove unused import and legacy compatibility code r=gps  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4180
11: firefoxtrees: fix templating issues under Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1485553) r=gps  Mercurial 4.7 made several changes at the template layer, including wrapping most displayable objects to enable usage with legacy templates. This commit wraps the output of `template_fxheads` when running under Mercurial 4.7.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4179
12: unifyrepo: make changeset hashes deterministic in test  Made an error in my initial implementation where I overwrite $HGRCPATH instead of appending. This commit fixes that issue.
13: unifyrepo: set `testedwith` to 4.6, acquire wlock before bookmark write  Now that we have tests for this extension, we can set the `testedwith` string as we do with other extensions. Since we only need the extension to work under 4.6 at the moment, this commit also gets rid of some compatibility conditionals.  After adding this change, the tests give a devel-warn about requiring a `wlock()` as well as a `lock()` to write bookmarks. This commit also adds that to the extension.
14: unifyrepo: re-enable OnFailure emails (Bug 1480203)  In writing tests for unifyrepo for bug 1484231, I came across an issue with how a variable is assigned during consecutive loops. This may have fixed bug 1480203 in the process. Turning emails back on while I deploy that change so we can verify.
15: unifyrepo: add test for daemon process (Bug 1484231) r=gps  This commit adds a test for the unify-daemon process. The main thing to test in this instance is that we can successfully use the script to specify an `hg` executable and config files.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3938
16: unifyrepo: add basic test functionality (Bug 1484231) r=gps  This commit adds a basic test for unifyrepo functionality. The test covers all available config options and a few failure conditions (no common ancestor, pushlog required).  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3937
17: unifyrepo: verify pushlog is available before repo unification (Bug 1484231) r=gps  This extension requires a pushlog to exist on every source repo to correctly function. While we are ensuring the repos have correct origin commits, we should also check for a pushlog.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3936
18: unifyrepo: set `path` variable correctly while iterating over source repos (Bug 1484231) r=gps  The path variable is set when iterating over the source repos the first time, but it is never reset to the correct source when iterating over the sources a second time. Therefore whatever repo was last in the iteration during the first loop will have the same name in the final loop.  This causes an issue in the `unifypushes` function, as we will hit the `if lastsource == source and lastid == pushid` condition when pushlogs between two separate repos have the same push id. For example, this condition will be true for repo1 push 1 and repo2 push 1, as source is the same for all repos. This is likely the root cause of bug 1480203, further testing will be required to know for certain.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3935
19: unifyrepo: move `hg replicatesync` call behind conditional flag (Bug 1484231) r=gps  Without this flag, `unifyrepo` is dependent on vcsreplicator to be tested. This means we require the hgmodocker environment to run tests on unifyrepo, and we currently don't have those features available in CI. With this flag we can turn off the replication call and test the extension without Docker.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3934

6: Bug 1485738: Add column number information to the JitSpew r=mgaudet  Summary: It is currently quite difficult to debug minified scripts.  The JitSpew and profiler used to display only line numbers, so all of the output would be emitted as "script:1".  Column number information is now collected by the gecko profiler as of bug 785922.  The JitSpew should also emit column numbers so that it's easy to line up with the profiler output.  Reviewers: mgaudet  Reviewed By: mgaudet  Subscribers: jandem  Bug #: 1485738  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4677

11: Bug 1471583. Add a new ImgDrawResult variant to distinguish INCOMPLETE and 'fully drew an image which wasn't really complete'. r=tnikkel
12: Bug 1471583. Don't record a successful image draw if the image isn't marked complete. r=mattwoodrow  The image can be decoded but we haven't notified such (and hence the image state doesn't indicate such). We are able to draw the image at this point because painting has special access to the image that bypasses the image state (this happens via nsStyleImage::StartDecoding -> imgIRequest::StartDecodingWithResult).  In this state if we record a successful draw then any parts of the image that we newly drew but weren't invalidated for some other reason won't get updated. When the async decode notification gets processed it will invalidate the image and that will result in it getting updated. But if we get a paint that asks for sync decoding of images before this it will see that we sucessfully drew the image and not invalidate its area and the sync decode paint won't update the image.  So we still draw the image but we don't record a successful draw unless the image state is complete and hence the decode notification has been processed (image state and notifications are always in sync).  Note that we still have to draw the image in this state because if we get a normal paint after a sync decode paint we have to draw the image because if we don't we effectively erase the image.
13: Bug 1478269 - Fix the outputs and clobbers of inline assembly blocks in yuv_row_posix.cpp. r=jrmuizel  While the current code compiles fine with the file as it is, with LTO enabled, some functions end up inlined into their callers and their callers, recursively, and the compiler doesn't know some of the registers have been modified by the assembly, leading to bad decisions, and bad behavior at runtime. The same problem would likely happen if we were using UNIFIED_SOURCES in the directory.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4200
14: Bug 1478269 - Use symbolic names as input operands. r=jrmuizel  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4199
15: Bug 1478269 - Remove ycbcr update script and patches. r=jrmuizel  ycbcr is dead upstream, and has been for almost as long as the code in the gecko tree hasn't been updated. Let's not pretend that we can actually run the update script and that having the patches separated matters, because there's no upstream to apply those patches to anymore.  Update README accordingly.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4198
16: Bug 1486654 - Enable static analysis on all Linux CI builds. r=ted  And turn off separate static analysis build tasks.
17: Bug 1486652 - Make x86 linux builds actual cross builds. r=ted  The x86 linux builds originally were performed in x86 build environment. That was a long time ago. Since then, they moved to x86-64 hosts with x86 headers and libraries. But for reasons that might have to do with the build system not really supporting cross-compilation nicely back then, the build is still explicitly passing both --host and --target, making those builds non-cross builds.  Since the toolchains used to build are for x86-64, the fact that --host is for x86 actually prevents enabling the clang plugin, so we need to turn these builds in actual cross builds if we want to enable the clang plugin.
18: Bug 1486938: Remove login-manager-storage category entry. r=MattN  This is an unused feature, with a strange implementation. If we need such an override in the future, it can be accomplished by just overriding a contract ID.  This patch also changes the implementation to simply define a contract ID for the appropriate default implementation at registration time rather than adding a duplicate platform check at runtime.
19: Bug 1482357 - Part 2. Drop panel parameter from assertAnimations  common functions. r=daisuke  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4417

1: Bug 1483043 - Only call SerializeURI if running in e10s. r=mak a=jorgk DONTBUILD  Some nsIURI types do not implement nsIIPCSerializableURI, and this is causing a crash in SerializeURI when running in thunderbird. This shouldn't happen, since thunderbird is not running under e10s, so even attempting to serialize the URIs is pointless.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3402
